item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Don’t let us forget that the causes of human actions are usually immeasurably more complex and varied than our subsequent explanations of them." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I mean they don't seem able to love us just the way we are. They don't seem able to love us unless they can keep changing us a little bit. They love their reasons for loving us almost as much as they love us, and most of the time more." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "People always clap for the wrong reasons." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I’m just sick of ego, ego, ego. My own and everybody else’s. I’m sick of everybody that wants to get somewhere, do something distinguished and all, be somebody interesting. It’s disgusting." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "If you do something too good, then, after a while, if you don't watch it, you start showing off. And then you're not as good any more." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "All morons hate it when you call them a moron." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "People never notice anything." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "They love their reasons for loving us almost as much as they love us, and most of the time more. It's not so good, that way." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "There isn’t a nightclub in the world that you can sit in for a long time unless you can at least buy some liquor and get drunk. Or unless you’re with some girl that really knocks you out." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I think if you don't really like a girl, you shouldn't horse around with her at all, and if you do like her, then you're supposed to like her face, and if you like her face, you ought to be careful about doing crumby stuff to it, like squirting water all over it. It's really too bad that so much crumby stuff is a lot of fun sometimes." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I privately say to you, old friend... please accept from me this unpretentious bouquet of early-blooming parentheses: (((())))." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "She wrote to him fairly regularly, from a paradise of triple exclamation points and inaccurate observations." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I don't know about bores. Maybe you shouldn't feel too sorry if you see some swell girl getting married to them. They don't hurt anybody, most of them, and maybe they're secretly all terrific whistlers or something. Who the hell knows? Not me." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "If only you’d remember before ever you sit down to write that you’ve been a reader long before you were ever a writer. You simply fix that fact in your mind, then sit very still and ask yourself, as a reader, what piece of writing in all the world Buddy Glass would most want to read if he had his heart’s choice. The next step is terrible, but so simple I can hardly believe it as I write it. You just sit down shamelessly and write the thing yourself. I won’t even underline that. It’s too important to be underlined." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "The cards are stacked (quite properly, I imagine) against all professional aesthetes, and no doubt we all deserve the dark, wordy, academic deaths we all sooner or later die." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Words! Mere words! How terrible they were! How clear, and vivid, and cruel! One could not escape from them. And yet what a subtle magic there was in them! They seemed to be able to give a plastic form to formless things, and to have a music of their own as sweet as that of viol or of lute. Mere words! Was there anything so real as words?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance." -- Oscar Wilde
